intro: Amauropelta fasciola, commonly known as the broad-leafed fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments such as streams and ponds. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce dense clusters of leaves. The fronds are pinnately compound, with pinnae that are often slightly curled at the tips.
